p: Previous publications have reported 120 [ 2, 92] or more [ 93, 94] terpenes in cannabis. Our search for terpenes with the correct chemical structures yielded a total of 120 terpenes. Terpenes, or isoprenoids, consist of the second largest class of cannabis constituents. These compounds are responsible for the characteristic aroma of the plant. Terpenes can be classified into five main classes: monoterpenes, sesquiterpenes, diterpenes, triterpenes, and miscellaneous terpenes. Out of 120 terpenes, there are 61 monoterpenes (C 10 skeleton), 51 sesquiterpenes (C 15 skeleton), 2 diterpenes, (C 20 skeleton), 2 triterpenes (C 30 skeleton), and 4 miscellaneous compounds.
